passages.text: All real living is meeting.
passages.context: Life happens in encounter. Outside of meeting, we're not fully alive.

passages.text: When two people relate to each other authentically and humanly, God is the electricity that surges between them.
passages.context: The divine isn't above or beyond — it's between. In true meeting, God happens.

passages.text: The world is not comprehensible, but it is embraceable: through the embracing of one of its beings.
passages.context: Understanding fails; embrace succeeds. The world is met through beings, not grasped through concepts.

passages.text: I do not accept any absolute formulas for living. No preconceived code can see ahead to everything that can happen in a man's life.
passages.context: Life exceeds formulas. No system anticipates the particular. Encounter demands improvisation.

passages.text: The Thou meets me through grace — it is not found by seeking.
passages.context: You can't engineer encounter. The Thou comes as gift, not achievement.

passages.text: When I confront a human being as my Thou and speak the basic word I-Thou to him, then he is no thing among things nor does he consist of things.
passages.context: To address as Thou is to see beyond thingness. The person stops being object among objects.

passages.text: Love is responsibility of an I for a Thou.
passages.context: Love isn't feeling — it's response-ability. The capacity to respond to the other as Thou.

passages.text: The purpose of relation is relation itself — touching the You. For through contact with every You we are stirred with a breath of the You, that is, of eternal life.
passages.context: Relationship isn't instrumental. The point of meeting is meeting itself. In every Thou, the Eternal.

passages.text: Man wishes to be confirmed in his being by man, and wishes to have a presence in the being of the other.
passages.context: We need to be seen, confirmed, present in another's awareness. Being alone isn't enough.

passages.text: Every particular Thou is a glimpse through to the eternal Thou.
passages.context: Each genuine encounter opens onto the infinite. The finite Thou reveals the eternal Thou.

passages.text: An animal's eyes have the power to speak a great language.
passages.context: I-Thou isn't limited to humans. Animals can be encountered, not just used.

passages.text: Solitude is the place of purification.
passages.context: Solitude prepares for encounter. Without purification in aloneness, meeting is muddied.

passages.text: Play is the exultation of the possible.
passages.context: Play isn't trivial — it's celebration of possibility. In play, potentiality rejoices.

passages.text: Nothing so much masks the face of God as religion.
passages.context: Religion can obscure what it claims to reveal. Institutional religion may hide the living God.

passages.text: A person cannot approach the divine by reaching beyond the human. To become human is what this individual person has been created for.
passages.context: Transcendence isn't escape from humanity — it's through humanity. Become fully human to approach the divine.

passages.text: The world is not divine sport, it is divine destiny. There is divine meaning in the life of the world.
passages.context: The world isn't God's game — it's God's purpose. Life has meaning not despite but because of divinity.

passages.text: One cannot divide one's life between an actual relationship to God and an inactual I-It relationship to the world.
passages.context: You can't relate to God as Thou while treating the world as It. The two relationships are one.

passages.text: We cannot avoid using power, but we can choose which power to use. We can choose to use the power of the I-It or the I-Thou.
passages.context: Power is unavoidable. The question is which kind: instrumental or relational, using or encountering.

passages.text: The real struggle is not between East and West, or capitalism and communism, but between education and propaganda.
passages.context: The fundamental conflict isn't political but epistemological: formation vs. manipulation.

passages.text: Spirit is not in the I but between I and You. It is not like the blood that circulates in you but like the air in which you breathe.
passages.context: Spirit isn't internal possession — it's relational medium. Not something you have but something you're in.
